Content.Question:
pear



"Medieval torturers devised a particularly gruesome tool known in English as the pear of confession." --J. Ayto, 1990
Content.Answer: pear: The fleshy edible fruit (a pome) of the tree Pyrus communis (see sense 2a), typically having a broad base and tapering or constricted towards the stalk. Also (usually with distinguishing word): the similar but round fruit of P. pyrifolia of eastern Asia (see nashi n.).Noun. Listed as a main definition. The original source of this word is listed as Aelfric of Eynsham. This word was first recored in 1020
Content.SuperMemoReference: <H5 dir=ltr align=left><Font size="1" style="color: transparent"> SuperMemo Reference:</font><br><FONT class=reference>Title:"My Test Quote" <br>Source: Oxford English Dictionary
